text: Greatly appreciate <@UAUCGGD6C> and <@U6C5KSWAC> for all of their hard work mentoring Julia on the <#C7WG4E7R9|exercism> platform

elements.text: for all of their hard work mentoring Julia on the

text: Thank you! Credit also to <@UB7JS9CHF>, <@U01ECBX4MB7>, <@U7K185TUN>  and others for their contributions!

I don't do much mentoring but thank you :slightly_smiling_face:

If you haven't seen it yet: <https://julialang.slack.com/archives/C7WG4E7R9/p1609173202028600>

attachments.fallback:
[December 28th, 2020 8:33 AM] saschamann: Some stats about the Julia track and <#C6FGJ8REC|appreciation> for the mentors:

22 people have mentored students on the Julia track in 2020. The median for mentored solutions per mentor is 21, the average is 65.

3 have mentored more than 100 solutions each, with one mentor having mentored 442 (!) solutions.

Mentors provided feedback on more than 1400 submitted solutions in total.

I don't have the names that are attached to the numbers and not everyone publicly lists themselves as mentor, so I can't point out who they are.
attachments.text:
Some stats about the Julia track and <#C6FGJ8REC|appreciation> for the mentors:

22 people have mentored students on the Julia track in 2020. The median for mentored solutions per mentor is 21, the average is 65.

3 have mentored more than 100 solutions each, with one mentor having mentored 442 (!) solutions.

Mentors provided feedback on more than 1400 submitted solutions in total.

I don't have the names that are attached to the numbers and not everyone publicly lists themselves as mentor, so I can't point out who they are.
